TextView.android:text: aptX is a lossy data compression format held by Qualcomm. With its 352 kbps bitrate aptX delivers decent quality audio with up to 48kHz sampling frequency and 16 bits per sample. \n\naptX's main trait is that it doesn't use psychoacoustic auditory masking techniques, so the project of this codec doesn't assume default incapabilities of human ear to be able to hear some parts of sound. aptX uses Adaptive Differential Pulse-Code Modulation. This process involves quantization which is the cause for losing some parts of the data. The Adaptation in this process in an addition to pure DPCM, which is suppose to vary the size of the quantization step in order to decrease loss of significant parts of the data.
